title: Ticket #913: CREAM GAHP commands need overhaul
description:
After the CREAM GAHP was written, the CREAM client API changed in ways that should be reflected in the GAHP commands. One such change is in CREAM_PROXY_RENEW. With the new API, the CREAM server URL and job ids are no longer required as arguments to CREAM_PROXY_RENEW, and are ignored by the GAHP. Those arguments should be removed.

We should also look at the other CREAM GAHP commands and see if changes are called for.
remarks:
2009-Nov-12 15:33:18 by jfrey:
The cream api allows the client to supply a list of jobs to the start command, but the gahp interface only allows only one job id to be supplied.

2009-Nov-19 16:34:07 by jfrey:
The Cream Register command returns the URLs for the job's input and output sandboxes, suitable for client-initiated file staging. The cream gahp includes the input URL in its reply, but not the output URL. It should include both.

2009-Nov-19 17:25:39 by jfrey:
All of these changes are going onto V7_5-cream_hardening-branch.

2009-Nov-23 15:32:19 by jfrey:
The Cream Register command no longer requires the URL of the delegation service as a parameter.
check_ins:
2009-Nov-24 13:59   Check-in [16454]: Remove delegation url from CREAM_JOB_REGISTER gahp command. #913 The URL of the delegation service was required for a job submission in the old cream api, but is no longer needed. (By Jaime Frey )
2009-Nov-19 17:12   Check-in [16394]: Add output URL to results of cream register gahp command. #913 (By Jaime Frey )
2009-Nov-17 14:37   Check-in [16360]: CREAM_JOB_START gahp command can now take a list of jobs. #913 The old syntax is also supported. (By Jaime Frey )
2009-Nov-17 10:42   Check-in [16355]: Use simplified CREAM_PROXY_RENEW gahp command. #913 (By Jaime Frey )
2009-Nov-17 10:41   Check-in [16354]: Simplify CREAM_PROXY_RENEW gahp command. #913 In the current version of the CREAM API, the CREAM service URL and job ids are no longer required when updating a delegated proxy. Those argument to CREAM_PROXY_RENEW are now optional. (By Jaime Frey )
creator: jfrey
